title: John Marshall (Third Lanark footballer)
text: John Marshall was a Scottish <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played for Wellpark, Harmonic, <a href="Third%20Lanark%20A.C.">Third Lanark</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a>, mainly as an <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Outside%20forward">outside forward</a>. Marshall played four times for Scotland between 1885 and 1887 and scored one goal on his debut in an 8–2 win against <a href="Ireland%20national%20football%20team%20%281882%E2%80%931950%29">Ireland</a> in March 1885. He was also selected for several of the <a href="Glasgow%20Football%20Association">Glasgow Football Association</a>'s challenge matches against other British city selections (a regular occurrence in the era), and at club level was a <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> winner with Third Lanark in <a href="1889%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1889</a>. He later became a football referee.
